title: Which activities make you lose track of time? - Quora

response.answer_text: Lately, it's been checking my messages, flirts, favoriteds, views, etc. on a couple different dating sites I just joined. For the last few nights, as I'm crawling into bed, I've said to myself that I'm just going to log in real quick and see if I have any interests before I go to sleep. Then, the next thing I notice is that's it's 4 or 5 o’clock in the morning & I don't know how it happened…AGAIN! Then I start to feel a little panic, worrying how much this sleep deprivation is going to send me to an early grave. Today I actually did an internet search to see what blood tests results change when you haven't slept. That eventually led me to trying to find out if the local nutrition shop sells Orexin-A (they don't). So I set my alarm for when I needed to get up, and then moaned outloud at myself when I realized that the alarm was going to go off only a few hours later. I sat down my phone and finally went to sleep.

I am not good in time management, so there are lot of activites where I lose time Talking to Mother :  When I am home after 6 months, and I start talking to my mom about what I did in those 6 months makes me lose track of time. I don't know when it becomes eveningTalking to Best friend: When I start talking and sharing my experiences, it goes on and in with time being an exception Obviously Quora: I come to quora just to check notification and with a deadline I will go and do some productive work in my research but in the end I end up doing research for answering quora questions Blogging:  I do write something and it also goes on, as it is part of research basically reading and writing Playing AOE and Counter strike :   We start playing with a motive that we will sleep early, but we end up sleeping morning 6 am after playing for that long without food Programming and Research :  When I start coding it takes endless time
